docs.text:
Introduction


Documentation for Byggeprojekt Web Services


This documentation describes Byggeprojekt API standards, data model, and endpoints. We strive for documentation that is understandable, detailed, and comprehensive. Please suggest edits when you feel we’re not accomplishing these goals.




Basics


Some basic conventions we've established.


The Byggeprojekt API is a 
REST
 API that uses predictable, resource-oriented URLs and standard 
HTTP response codes
. It uses built-in HTTP features, such as HTTP authentication and HTTP verbs, so it can be understood by off-the-shelf HTTP clients.


Description Of Usual Server Responses


Byggeproject API uses conventional HTTP response codes to indicate the success or failure of an API request. In general, codes in the 2xx range indicate success, codes in the 4xx range indicate an error that failed given the information provided (e.g., a required parameter was omitted, a charge failed, etc.), and codes in the 5xx range indicate an error with Byggeprojekt's server (these are rare).


Not all errors map cleanly onto HTTP response codes, however. When a request is valid but does not complete successfully (e.g., a card is declined), we return a 402 error code. To understand why a card is declined, refer to the list of codes in the 
documentation
. 








Code


Description










200 
OK


The request was successful.






201 
Created


The request was successful and a resource was created.






204 
No Content


The request was successful but there is no representation to return (i.e. the response is empty).






400 
Bad Request


The request could not be understood or was missing required parameters.






401 
Unauthorized


Authentication failed or user doesn't have permissions for requested operation.






403 
Forbidden


Access denied.






404 
Not Found


Resource was not found.






405 
Method Not Allowed


Requested method is not supported for resource.








HTTP Verbs


Byggeprojekt’s API follows IETF standards (
RFC 5789
 & 
RFC 7231
) when using HTTP methods. A summary is provided below:








Verb


Used for...










GET


Retrieving records






POST


Creating records






PUT


Replacing records






PATCH


Updating records






DELETE


Deleting records








URL encoding


URLs can only be sent over the Internet using the 
ASCII character-set
.


Since URLs often contain characters outside the ASCII set, the URL has to be converted into a valid ASCII format.


URL encoding replaces unsafe ASCII characters with a 
%
 followed by two hexadecimal digits.


URLs cannot contain spaces. URL encoding normally replaces a space with a plus 
+
 sign or with 
%20
.


Nomenclature


We use consistent naming to describe concepts and features of an API:








Word


Meaning


Example










Object


Represents and defines a common record.


The 
Document object






Endpoint


An API method


/api/v0/auth/gettoken






Parameter


A variable value passed to an endpoint


/api/v0/auth/gettoken
 needs a 
login
 and 
password
 parameter






Request


Calling an endpoint via an HTTP request


-






Response


The result of an HTTP request to an endpoint


-








Security


Byggeprojekt values the security of your data, and all API requests must be made over 
HTTPS
.


Support


Our team is happy to answer any questions, address any frustrations, or consider any requests. You can communicate with us by emailing 
help@byggeprojekt.dk
.


We'll do our best to accommodate you.
docs.title: Home

docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: Some basic conventions we've established.  The Byggeprojekt API is a  REST  API that uses predictable, resource-oriented URLs and standard  HTTP response codes . It uses built-in HTTP features, such as HTTP authentication and HTTP verbs, so it can be understood by off-the-shelf HTTP clients.  Description Of Usual Server Responses  Byggeproject API uses conventional HTTP response codes to indicate the success or failure of an API request. In general, codes in the 2xx range indicate success, codes in the 4xx range indicate an error that failed given the information provided (e.g., a required parameter was omitted, a charge failed, etc.), and codes in the 5xx range indicate an error with Byggeprojekt's server (these are rare).  Not all errors map cleanly onto HTTP response codes, however. When a request is valid but does not complete successfully (e.g., a card is declined), we return a 402 error code. To understand why a card is declined, refer to the list of codes in the  documentation .      Code  Description      200  OK  The request was successful.    201  Created  The request was successful and a resource was created.    204  No Content  The request was successful but there is no representation to return (i.e. the response is empty).    400  Bad Request  The request could not be understood or was missing required parameters.    401  Unauthorized  Authentication failed or user doesn't have permissions for requested operation.    403  Forbidden  Access denied.    404  Not Found  Resource was not found.    405  Method Not Allowed  Requested method is not supported for resource.     HTTP Verbs  Byggeprojekt’s API follows IETF standards ( RFC 5789  &  RFC 7231 ) when using HTTP methods. A summary is provided below:     Verb  Used for...      GET  Retrieving records    POST  Creating records    PUT  Replacing records    PATCH  Updating records    DELETE  Deleting records     URL encoding  URLs can only be sent over the Internet using the  ASCII character-set .  Since URLs often contain characters outside the ASCII set, the URL has to be converted into a valid ASCII format.  URL encoding replaces unsafe ASCII characters with a  %  followed by two hexadecimal digits.  URLs cannot contain spaces. URL encoding normally replaces a space with a plus  +  sign or with  %20 .  Nomenclature  We use consistent naming to describe concepts and features of an API:     Word  Meaning  Example      Object  Represents and defines a common record.  The  Document object    Endpoint  An API method  /api/v0/auth/gettoken    Parameter  A variable value passed to an endpoint  /api/v0/auth/gettoken  needs a  login  and  password  parameter    Request  Calling an endpoint via an HTTP request  -    Response  The result of an HTTP request to an endpoint  -     Security  Byggeprojekt values the security of your data, and all API requests must be made over  HTTPS .  Support  Our team is happy to answer any questions, address any frustrations, or consider any requests. You can communicate with us by emailing  help@byggeprojekt.dk .  We'll do our best to accommodate you.
docs.title: Basics

docs.text:
Authentication


Request Purpose


Authenticate user and receive authentication token for access to other methods.


Request Type


GET


Request Endpoint


/api/v0/auth/gettoken


Request Parameters








Parameter


Description










login


User login.






password


User password.








Request Example


https://app.byggeprojekt.dk/api/v0/auth/gettoken?login=iirsoft3&password=password


Response Example


{
    "statusMessage":"Success",
    "statusCode":200,
        "body":{
            "token":"13a6833433774dda8dd8ef8979d1180c",
            "expirationDate":"Jun 3, 2017 9:59:34 AM"
       }
}




Response Objects and fields








Parameter


Description










statusCode


Result code of request. Describes if request was successfully executed.






statusMessage


Description to statusCode.














body


Object with result for request.














token


Security token, should be used in next requests.






expirationDate


Expiration date of token.
docs.title: Authentication
Authentication

docs.text:
Projects


Request Purpose


Get list of projects which are available for specified user.


Request Type


GET


Request Endpoint


/api/v0/project/getprojects


Request Parameters








Parameter


Description










token


Authentication token.








Request Example


https://app.byggeprojekt.dk/api/v0/project/getprojects?token=13a6833433774dda8dd8ef8979d1180c


Response Type:


json


Response Example


{
   "statusMessage":"Success",
   "statusCode":200,
        "body":{
            "projects":[
                {"id":1599,"name":"[02818] - P1"}
            ]
        }
}




Response Objects and fields








Parameter


Description










statusCode


Result code of request. Describes if request was successfully executed.






statusMessage


Description to statusCode.














body


Object with result for request.














projects


list with project objects.














id


Identifier of project.






name


Name of project.
docs.title: Projects
Projects

docs.text:
Projects


Request Purpose


Get list of folders which are available for specified user in the specified project.


Request Type


GET


Request Endpoint


/api/v0/folder/getfolders


Request Parameters








Parameter


Description










token


Authentication token.






projectid


Identifier of project.






parentfolderid


Identifier of parent folder. Not needed if root level folders are requested.






all


if all folders of project should be returned, parameter 
all
 should be set as 
"true"
. In this case parameter 
parentFolderId
 is not needed. Parameter 
all
 should not be passed if 
parentfolderid
 parameter is passed.








Response Type:


json


Example 1


Request Example


https://app.byggeprojekt.dk/api/v0/folder/getfolders?token=13a6833433774dda8dd8ef8979d1180c&projectid=1599


Response Example


{
       "statusMessage":"Success",
       "statusCode":200,
            "body":{
                "folders":[
                      {"id":74950,"name":"F1","projectId":1599},
                      {"id":76384,"name":"F2","projectId":1599}
                ]
       }
}




Example 2


Request Example


https://app.byggeprojekt.dk/api/v0/folder/getfolders?token=13a6833433774dda8dd8ef8979d1180c&projectid=1599&parentfolderid=74950


Response Example


{
       "statusMessage":"Success",
       "statusCode":200,
            "body":{
                 "folders":[
                      {"id":76385,"name":"F1_1","parentFolderId":74950,"projectId":1599}
            ]
       }
  }




Example 3


Request Example


https://app.byggeprojekt.dk/api/v0/folder/getfolders?token=13a6833433774dda8dd8ef8979d1180c&projectid=1599&all=true


Response Example


{
   "statusMessage":"Success",
   "statusCode":200,
        "body":{
             "folders":[
                  {"id":74950,"name":"F1","projectId":1599},
                  {"id":76385,"name":"F1_1","parentFolderId":74950,"projectId":1599},
                  {"id":76384,"name":"F2","projectId":1599}
        ]
   }
}




Response Objects and fields








Parameter


Description










statusCode


Result code of request. Describes if request was successfully executed.






statusMessage


Description to statusCode.














body


Object with result for request.






folders


List with folder objects.














id


Identifier of folder.






name


Name of folder.






parentFolderId


Identifier of parent folder.






projectId


Identifier of project.

Not needed if root level folders are requested.    all  if all folders of project should be returned, parameter  all  should be set as  "true" . In this case parameter  parentFolderId  is not needed. Parameter  all  should not be passed if  parentfolderid  parameter is passed.     Response Type:  json

docs.text:
Documents


Request Purpose


Get list of documents which are available for specified user in the specified folder/project.


Request Type


GET


Request Endpoint


/api/v0/folder/getdocuments


Request Parameters








Parameter


Description










token


Authentication token.






projectid


Identifier of project.






parentfolderid


Identifier of parent folder. Not needed if root level folders are requested.






all


If all documents of project should be returned, parameter 
all
 should be set as 
"true"
. In this case parameter 
parentFolderId
 is not needed. Parameter 
all
 should not be passed if 
parentfolderid
 parameter is passed.








Response Type


json


Example 1


Request Example


https://app.byggeprojekt.dk/api/v0/document/getdocuments?token=13a6833433774dda8dd8ef8979d1180c&projectid=1599&parentfolderid=74950


Response Example


{
       "statusMessage":"Success",
       "statusCode":200,
       "body":{
            "documents": [
                 {
                      "id":324020,
                      "name":"mail_lang_da",
                      "version":0,
                      "parentFolderId":74950,
                      "projectId":1599,
                      "format":"",
                      "scale":"",
                      "revision_number":"",
                      "fileSize":1534,
                      "uploadDate":"Jun 6, 2017 9:51:03 AM",
                      "documentDescription":"",
                      "documentCreator":"John Smith - Codescriptor company 2",
                      "url":"http://download.byggeprojekt.dk/dwnl/download/Z6SyuLaWePVbY3Qhnw71LnXwedfdERbq5ivSgLtcx3ZN3aBooSIyuSmy9UwUraIASwxzF7s-IhLZf_uWnK_pod7llIRIXmu6_8b_8_yyWu3VmOOW36BMdLCMYrKeGtMlNxF_pLjXISs="
                 }
            ]
       }
  }




Example 2

https://app.byggeprojekt.dk/api/v0/document/getdocuments?token=13a6833433774dda8dd8ef8979d1180c&projectid=1599&all=true

                      "documentDescription":"",
                      "documentCreator":"John Smith - Codescriptor company 2",
                      "url":"http://download.byggeprojekt.dk/dwnl/download/Z6SyuLaWePVbY3Qhnw71LnXwedfdERbq5ivSgLtcx3ZN3aBooSIyuSmy9UwUraIASwxzF7s-IhLZf_uWnK_poYGxoc7SG3Bm_8b_8_yyWu0nEk-BCczttbCMYrKeGtMlCVwv6WPZX8Q="
                 },
                 {
                      "id":324020,
                      "name":"mail_lang_da",
                      "version":0,

                      "projectId":1599,

                 }
            ]
       }
  }




Response Objects and fields








Parameter


Description










statusCode


Result code of request. Describes if request was successfully executed.






statusMessage


Description to statusCode.














body


Object with result for request.






documents


List with documents objects.








Document object 








Parameter


Description










id


Identifier of document.






name


Name of document.






version


Version of document.






parentFolderId


Identifier of parent folder.






projectId


Identifier of project.






format


Metadata field.






scale


Metadata field.






revision_number


Metadata field.






fileSize


Size of files in bytes.






uploadDate


Date of uploading the version of file.






documentDescription


Description of document.






documentCreator


Creator of document.






url


URL for downloading the file.

Not needed if root level folders are requested.    all  If all documents of project should be returned, parameter  all  should be set as  "true" . In this case parameter  parentFolderId  is not needed. Parameter  all  should not be passed if  parentfolderid  parameter is passed.     Response Type  json

docs.title: Document object

docs.text:
Upload


Request Purpose


Uploading document into system.


Request Type


POST


Request Endpoint


/api/v0/auth/upload


Request Parameters








Parameter


Description










token


Authentication token.






folderId


Identifier of folder into which should be uploaded files.






isLastFileInSession


Optional. 
true
 or 
false
 value for pointing if file or files last in upload session. If parameter not signed in request files will be uploaded like last in session






uploadSessionId


Optional. Required if some files was uploaded earlier and it is need upload files in the same upload session.








Also to request must be attached file parts.


Response Objects and fields








Parameter


Description










statusCode


Result code of request. Describes if request was successfully or unsuccessfully executed.






statusMessage


Description to statusCode.






body


Object with result for request.






uploadSessionId


Upload session identifier, should be used for next uploads in the same session.






documents


Array of document objects. See 
document object








Example 1


Request


http://app.byggeprojekt.dk/api/v0/upload/uploadFile?token=218e104134ac40e584cec96bdd6089f5&folderId=40243&isLastFileInSession=true


Response


 


{
    "statusMessage":"Success",
    "statusCode":200,
    "body": {
        "documents":[{
            "id":153832,
            "name":"TEST_FILE.txt",
            "version":0,
            "parentFolderId":40243,
            "projectId":5376,
            "format":"",
            "scale":"",
            "revision_number":"",
            "fileSize":8,
            "uploadDate":"Aug 23, 2017 2:10:10 PM",
            "documentDescription":"",
            "documentCreator":"Jeff Beck - Company",
            "url":"http://download.byggeprojekt.dk/dwnl/download/Z6SyuLaWePVbY3Qhnw71LnXwedfdERbq5ivSgLtcx3ZN3aBooSIyuSmy9UwUraIASwxzF7s-IhL0u8xNw7O4WFuXr4AnXPkdOUdV4HnGTIDpV72BkQYxiMiOzojpYVU1Eoj4kK7EjLqnNXb1X5w1sw=="
        }]
    }
}




Example 2


Request


http://localhost:8888/byggeprojekt/api/v0/upload/uploadFile?token=218e104134ac40e584cec96bdd6089f5&folderId=40243&isLastFileInSession=false


Response


 


{
    "statusMessage":"Success",
    "statusCode":200,
    "body":{
        "uploadSessionId":"1503486877394"
    }
}




Error codes








Code


Message










401


Authentication problem






402


No 
token
 parameter






413


Wrong 
folderid
 parameter






416


Wrong 
isLastFileInSession
 parameter






417


No 
folderid
 parameter






421


No files attached






431


Current user have not permissions for uploading into folder






444


Application is not ready, try again after few minutes

Control charachters


The ASCII control characters %00-%1F were originally designed to control hardware devices.
Control characters have nothing to do inside a URL.








ASCII Character


Description


URL-encoding










NUL


null character


%00






SOH


start of header


%01






STX


start of text


%02






ETX


end of text


%03






EOT


end of transmission


%04






ENQ


enquiry


%05






ACK


acknowledge


%06






BEL


bell (ring)


%07






BS


backspace


%08






HT


horizontal tab


%09






LF


line feed


%0A






VT


vertical tab


%0B






FF


form feed


%0C






CR


carriage return


%0D






SO


shift out


%0E






SI


shift in


%0F






DLE


data link escape


%10






DC1


device control 1


%11






DC2


device control 2


%12






DC3


device control 3


%13






DC4


device control 4


%14






NAK


negative acknowledge


%15






SYN


synchronize


%16






ETB


end transmission block


%17






CAN


cancel


%18






EM


end of medium


%19






SUB


substitute


%1A






ESC


escape


%1B






FS


file separator


%1C






GS


group separator


%1D






RS


record separator


%1E






US


unit separator


%1F
docs.title: URL encoding reference

docs.text:
The ASCII control characters %00-%1F were originally designed to control hardware devices.
Control characters have nothing to do inside a URL.     ASCII Character  Description  URL-encoding      NUL  null character  %00    SOH  start of header  %01    STX  start of text  %02    ETX  end of text  %03    EOT  end of transmission  %04    ENQ  enquiry  %05    ACK  acknowledge  %06    BEL  bell (ring)  %07    BS  backspace  %08    HT  horizontal tab  %09    LF  line feed  %0A    VT  vertical tab  %0B    FF  form feed  %0C    CR  carriage return  %0D    SO  shift out  %0E    SI  shift in  %0F    DLE  data link escape  %10    DC1  device control 1  %11    DC2  device control 2  %12    DC3  device control 3  %13    DC4  device control 4  %14    NAK  negative acknowledge  %15    SYN  synchronize  %16    ETB  end transmission block  %17    CAN  cancel  %18    EM  end of medium  %19    SUB  substitute  %1A    ESC  escape  %1B    FS  file separator  %1C    GS  group separator  %1D    RS  record separator  %1E    US  unit separator  %1F
